p: None of the extracts from maceration technique showed zone of inhibition equivalent to zone of inhibition obtained through essential oil from hydrodistillation method (>30 mm). However, ethanol extract was the nearest and was efficient against only two species of Candida, that is, C. albicans, (10 mm) and C. tropicalis (14 mm). Ether (8 mm) and chloroform (10 mm) were effective only against C. tropicalis. n-butanol and methanol extracts were not effective against any Candida spp.
